title: Why does no one respect pick order in ranked?

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
Why is it that people dont respect pick order anymore. I hit 'Fill' I queue up, it pops, I'm first pick. Last pick is "Bot". I tell them that I'm going to adc this game and they get all shitty saying that they are bot because it was their preferred pick.

When i link them the picture above of the current summoners code, which says if you're the last to pick try to fill.

Why does no one respect pick order since this new queue system came in that allocates you a preferred role.... its just a preferred role not the role you get.

replies.body:
To clarify, pick order is no longer relevant in New Champ Select/Ranked. Your assigned role takes precedence and taking a role you were not assigned is REPORTABLE AND PUNISHABLE. You are perfectly welcome to ask someone with the role you would prefer if they will trade. So long as the change is agreed upon there is nothing wrong with it at all, but taking a role just because you are first pick and picked fill is not ok.
___
> If new Champ Select gave you "Top," and you force Jungle on your teammates, that's bannable.

___

> This is not really about meta or not, you queued up for Top, you get Top, you play Top. This isn't about Champions

___
>We can auto-detect it, and players can report it under Unsportsmanlike Behaviors too.
___

Thank you for putting this to rest.

Pick order is irrelevant now. You select the role you want to fill pre-lobby. It searches for a game that matches you to other players who want to fill the other roles. When you are in the champ select lobby, each person is given a 'role'. You are expected to play this roll. You may queue as a 'fill', but the game will give you a specific role when it fits you into a team. This role can be seen under your name in the champion select lobby. "Bot" is ADC, everything else is self explanatory.

It is not a "preferred role". It is the role the game gave you. If it were a 'preferred role', we would never end up loading into a champion select with our "secondary" role. It would always show our primary preferred role. The new champion select allocates you a role based on what everyone else has been allocated. You will never get into a champion select with a role of "fill". The game gives you an explicit role.

Riot have said before that if you "steal" somebodies role, you can be reported for it. They've said they have the data of who was assigned which role and where they went in-game.

When have riot said that if you steal somebodies role you can be reported?

if the roles you pick as primary and secondary aren't 'preferred' then what are they?

The roles you pick are primary and secondary are 'preferred'. The role you are assigned in the champion select lobby isn't. It is the role the system has assigned you so as to eliminate all debates about who gets what role in champion select.

Why is it fair that somebody who selects mid/top roles waits in queue for 10 minutes, but you, who picks fill, waits in queue for 15 seconds, then gets to take any role you want just because you were randomly assigned first place in champion select? Why is it fair that, even though the system assigns you as "support"(or what ever role the system assigns you for that match), you get to override that and pick a role somebody else has been assigned?

It is very obviously not just a matter of declaring "I would like to play this role if allowed", or the queue times wouldn't be so drastically different. The system also wouldn't change "fill" to a specific role when you enter champion select.

Not to answer someone elses argument, but it looks like you answered it yourself. It's fair because pick order is random, if they were above the OP in pick order then the OP would fill whatever role they were assigned....

But that ISN'T fair because it's completely negating the point of picking roles in the first place. The entire reason for picking 2 roles is for the system to place you with a team that fills the other roles. The entire point of "fill" is for the player to "fill in" any leftover roles, not to choose any role they want. You're choosing roles for the system to search with. If it was just a "preferred" role, you wouldn't have choose 2 roles, or fill. You could select any number of 'preferred roles'. It also wouldn't assign you a single role in the lobby, it would just list your preferred roles that you selected. There also wouldn't be clashes when too many people try to select the same roles in a premade, since it would assume the premade knows what it's doing.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/site/2016-season-update/new-champ-select.html

>Requiring two positions ensures short queue times **_and that no one on your team gets stuck in a position they don't want to play._** We know some options (*cough* support and jungle) aren't always quite as popular, and plan to incentivize these roles with IP bonuses if necessary.

http://i.imgur.com/xqsxPtw.jpg?1

>Position **_ASSIGNMENT_**

>Everyone learns **_where they're headed_** at the same time.

Face it, all the evidence is showing that it's an assigned role, not a preferred role.

The whole point of the preference system is so that the draft phase doesn't revolve around pick order, call order and other forms of unnecessary antagonising.

I understand that picking "fill" may lead to a shorter queue times but if you're going to ignore what you're allocated there's a good chance the game won't go smoothly and you'll regret it immediately.

After all, you selected your preferences (and if you don't like what you got as fill, you shouldn't pick fill). Even then, if you didn't get the role you wanted you simply ask to swap with someone else. Pick order has no role in getting the position you want, it's teamwork and civility.

We probably aren't talking about the same thing. OP suggested that Pick Order overrules position assignment and I suggested that for the sake of team cohesion you stick with your assigned position. Whether or not your team allows you to go top lane as a support is closer related to the community's fixation on upholding the meta rather than the way you select champions. Nothing stops you from asking your team to support the top laner and you certainly don't need a pick preference to achieve that.

Queue for top lane and pick a support champion.

The 'roles' you pick are merely your location in the game. "Support" is only named as such because it's how the meta has been for so long, and to avoid confusion between two "Bot" players in champion select.
